com.moomoohk.Mootilities.Swing

Class FrameDragger

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
      • com.moomoohk.Mootilities.Swing.FrameDragger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class FrameDragger
extends java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
implements java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    A simple tool that enables the dragging of windows around the screen.

    Usage: 

     new FrameDragger().applyTo(window);
    Since:
    Dec 24, 2013
    Author:
    Meshulam Silk (moomoohk@ymail.com)

      • applyTo

        public void applyTo(java.awt.Component c)
        Will make a Component draggable.

      • applyTo

        public void applyTo(java.awt.Component c,
                    java.lang.Runnable onPress,
                    java.lang.Runnable onRelease,
                    java.lang.Runnable onDrag)
        Will make a Component draggable and add hooks that will be run at different events.
        Parameters:
        c - Component to make draggable
        onPress - Hook that will run when the mouse presses on the component
        onRelease - Hook that will run when the mouse releases the component
        onDrag - Hook that will run when the component is dragged
